name: audience_quarter_anomalies
description:
This mart model identifies anomalies in audience performance metrics for the current quarter.
It aggregates key metrics by Company and Target Audience, calculates rolling statistics (mean, standard deviation)
based on the previous three quarters, and uses Z-scores to flag significant deviations (>2 standard deviations)
from the historical trend. The model provides context for each anomaly, including its potential impact (positive/negative)
and a descriptive summary, aiding in performance monitoring and risk management.
Time Context: Current Quarter (based on the latest data in stg_campaigns)
Grain: Company, Target_Audience for the current quarter

columns.name: Company
columns.description: The name of the company associated with the campaign data. Primary dimension for analysis.

columns.name: Target_Audience
columns.description: The specific audience segment targeted by the campaigns within the company. Secondary dimension for analysis.

columns.name: avg_conversion_rate
columns.description: Average conversion rate for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: conversion_rate_mean
columns.description: Rolling average conversion rate calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: conversion_rate_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of conversion rate calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: conversion_rate_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's average conversion rate, indicating deviation from the rolling mean in terms of rolling standard deviations.

columns.name: conversion_rate_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's average conversion rate is considered an anomaly ('anomaly') or within the expected range ('normal') based on a Z-score threshold (>|2|).

columns.name: avg_roi
columns.description: Average Return on Investment (ROI) for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: roi_mean
columns.description: Rolling average ROI calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: roi_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of ROI calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: roi_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's average ROI.

columns.name: roi_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's average ROI is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: avg_acquisition_cost
columns.description: Average Acquisition Cost for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_mean
columns.description: Rolling average Acquisition Cost calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of Acquisition Cost calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's average Acquisition Cost.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's average Acquisition Cost is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: total_clicks
columns.description: Total number of clicks for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: clicks_mean
columns.description: Rolling average total clicks calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: clicks_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of total clicks calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: clicks_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's total clicks.

columns.name: clicks_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's total clicks is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: total_impressions
columns.description: Total number of impressions for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: impressions_mean
columns.description: Rolling average total impressions calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: impressions_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of total impressions calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: impressions_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's total impressions.

columns.name: impressions_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's total impressions is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: quarterly_ctr
columns.description: Click-Through Rate (CTR) calculated for the company-audience segment over the entire current quarter (Total Clicks / Total Impressions).

columns.name: ctr_mean
columns.description: Rolling average quarterly CTR calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: ctr_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of quarterly CTR calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: ctr_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's CTR.

columns.name: ctr_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's CTR is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: campaign_count
columns.description: Total number of distinct campaigns run for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: campaign_count_mean
columns.description: Rolling average campaign count calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: campaign_count_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of campaign count calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: campaign_count_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's campaign count.

columns.name: campaign_count_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's campaign count is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: total_spend
columns.description: Estimated total spend for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: spend_mean
columns.description: Rolling average total spend calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: spend_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of total spend calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: spend_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's total spend.

columns.name: spend_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's total spend is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: total_revenue
columns.description: Estimated total revenue generated for the company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: revenue_mean
columns.description: Rolling average total revenue calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: revenue_std
columns.description: Rolling population standard deviation of total revenue calculated over the 3 quarters preceding the current quarter.

columns.name: revenue_z
columns.description: Z-score for the current quarter's total revenue.

columns.name: revenue_anomaly
columns.description: Flag indicating if the current quarter's total revenue is an anomaly ('anomaly') or normal ('normal').

columns.name: has_anomaly
columns.description: Boolean flag indicating TRUE if at least one metric for this company-audience segment in the current quarter is flagged as an anomaly.

columns.name: anomaly_count
columns.description: The total number of individual metrics flagged as anomalies for this company-audience segment in the current quarter.

columns.name: anomaly_impact
columns.description: Categorizes the overall impact of detected anomalies as 'positive' (e.g., unusually high ROI, low cost), 'negative' (e.g., unusually low ROI, high cost), or 'normal' if no significant anomalies are detected.

columns.name: anomaly_description
columns.description: A human-readable description summarizing the most prominent anomaly detected (based on the order of checks in the CASE statement), or NULL if no anomaly is detected.
